Reviews.Title: Satisfied
Reviews.Author: Sundaravadivel N
Reviews.Content: The laptop performance is very good. I had bought a costlier dell few days back but comparing Dell with this product, i definitely can say that this is better.System boots very quickly.System fan doesn't make much sound.The webcam is good.Depth of the sound output is good.The laptop looks pretty sturdy.Keyboard is very soft and this is one thing that i am not sure whether it will have a problem in future. I have been using Mac book and the key board in mac is solid but lenovo's key doesn't. May be it is good or bad. Have to wait and see.This is one of the best laptop for normal day-to-day use.

Reviews.Title: Disappointed.
Reviews.Author: Lars M. Hansen
Reviews.Content: A laptop out of the box should work. Everything should work. With this one, that was not the case.The WiFi on mine was not working out of the box. How can a laptop be shipped from the factory with bad WiFi driver? How does that happen? So, after some basic troubleshooting, I gave up on the wireless, connected via an ethernet cable, and got the new driver from Lenovo's website. That solved the problem, at least for now.Once WiFi was working, I installed all the updates for Windows 8, then applied the Windows 8.1 update. And, guess what? The WiFi stopped working. Applying the same formula as before, I got the 8.1 WiFi driver from Lenovo's website, and installed them with the expectation that this would resolve the issue. It did not. After installing the new drivers, I still have no WiFi. No amount of driver cleanup, WiFi profile deletions and "Lenovo wireless driver" uninstall would fix the issue.After reading through several pages of posts on Lenovo's support forum, I found the fix that worked for me: Download and installed the Windows 8.0 WiFi driver (and not the 8.1 driver). Once this driver was installed, the WiFi came to life.Considering the amount of traffic this particular topic on the support forum seems to be getting, how come Lenovo can't solve the issue? If the 8.1 driver is bad, why is it still listed on their website?

Reviews.Title: Great Value!
Reviews.Author: yankeelady
Reviews.Content: Good, sturdy laptop  for the price. Great battery life, runs well - just don't like windows 8. I highly recommend

Reviews.Title: Buyer Beware
Reviews.Author: Jeff Campbell
Reviews.Content: The hard drive in my Lenovo laptop failed one week after the warranty expired.  Much ado is made about Lenovo's "One Key Recovery" software, which won't be worth a hoot if your hard drive is not functioning.

Reviews.Title: Pretty solid performance for the price tag
Reviews.Author: Dan
Reviews.Content: This computer does not cost very much, and as such is not the most amazing computer you will find out there. However, if you are looking for a computer to get the job done at home or at work and not break the bank, then this might be a good fit.One benefit that I liked was the keyboard. The keys are raised nicely and give a good response when I type. Also, I am notorious for bumping track pads when I type, and that has not happened as often with this device. It has a dedicated numpad section to the right, so that is nice if you are typing a bunch of numbers.It is also nice because it has an optical disk drive. Many of the less expensive computers I looked at did not have one to save space and money, which means I would need to buy a separate drive, and thus you become slightly less portable.It was fast enough to run my favorite game, Lord of the Rings Online, using DirectX 10 at high settings (my Asus can run it on ultra high and everything turned up, but it was also 3 times as expensive.)A drawback to it is that it contains Windows 8 and is not a touch screen. I have Windows 8 on a tablet and its fine, but without a touch screen I am not as big a fan. It is a little harder to navigate this way and the benefit of Windows 8 is lost on a nontouch screen.

Reviews.Title: Whiners
Reviews.Author: thurman fionn
Reviews.Content: Everyone says that windows 8 is bad and I agree with them but the review section is for the review of the product not the software it runs. Get windows 7 if your going to complain about the operating system.

Reviews.Title: I like
Reviews.Author: Brizeida
Reviews.Content: Buy this computer for basic work. Therefore the price is reasonable for equipment of this type. Not the latest technology, but buy it for a young student who starts and needs to learn. Recommended if not required to perform special tasks.

Reviews.Title: Terrible! Buyer beware!
Reviews.Author: Sean Gaffney
Reviews.Content: Purchased this laptop because I needed an affordable machine to connect me to my online classes. About a week after the amazon return policy expired the screen on my laptop stopped working. I take great care of my belongings - my last computer lasted nearly 8 years before it became ungodly slow. Now I'm stuck with a broken Lenovo laptop that amazon won't accept as a return and a horribly outdated computer. Worst experience ever!

Reviews.Title: Had to send it back period key did not work right.
Reviews.Author: tonic67
Reviews.Content: I have another Lenovo which has worked for years without any issues.  I am using it now as a matter of fact, but I wanted to upgrade and let my daughter use the old one.  I got the other and the period key never worked well had to be pressed hard and several times, I thought it might just have to be cleaned or broken in, but it never worked.  I returned it.I bought another through lenovo and it worked ok for a month (g510) and then it just went to white screen one day.  So that is out for repair.  Not sure what is up with Lenovo's quality these days, but make sure when you buy you get full warranty and maybe even damage warranty to be on the safe side.That all being said, Lenovo's customer service is pretty good thus far.  They offered to take and fix both laptops.  The first one I just returned to Amazon (again great customer service), the second one I bought directly from Lenovo because they were the only one's selling it, and so they sent me a fedex return box and they paid for shipping.  I packed it up called Fed Ex and they picked up later the same day.  It has been delivered to Lenovo at this time, and I am waiting to hear back from the service department with respect to what is wrong with it and if and when it will be fixed.  I just hope they don't try to stick me with a bill, as the computer was only one month old, never dropped or manhandled in anyway and it has to be a motherboard or screen issue that was defective from the get go.  We shall see.

Reviews.Title: Very good computer for the price
Reviews.Author: W. Davis
Reviews.Content: I purchased this computer for combination personal / business use, and it is meeting my expectations for that. It is plenty fast for me, and I have not had any problems with it.I see some have complained about Windows 8, and one good thing is that you can upgrade to 8.1 at no cost. Also, there is an excellent tip here on Amazon on how to avoid the opening screen in Windows 8 and open the screen up more like Windows 7.We have Lenovo computers where I work and that is why I went with this brand. I was not disappointed.

Reviews.Title: computer
Reviews.Author: sherm
Reviews.Content: This item was marred when received. The item was what I really wanted processor speed latest OS, etc. However, I really do not like to reorder especially after receiving a problem item.

Reviews.Title: great deal
Reviews.Author: Sireesha Aluri
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a good laptop with all the basic features at a reasonable price.Go for it!

Reviews.Title: Too difficult to use.
Reviews.Author: Luciano Silvestri B
Reviews.Content: I want to know if I do have the chance to trade this computer I bought to a window 7 again. This particular computer is giving me many troubles. It is too complicated. To use the computer I must read a manual that comes with the computer if not I won't be able to use the computer. It is not fear. I really don't have the time to start reading manuals to work with a computer after more than 20 year using computers simply because Windows 8 now is too complicated trying to imitate Apple. The keyboard is not efficient. it is impossible to type quickly because it will miss letters. While I am using the computer  all kind of advertisements interrupt me even if I am in internet or not. Every window you want to open and use for first time you must give an email and password first. I am really getting sick and tired of using this computer.  I just want to know if I still have the chance to return the computer and change it back to a Window 7. Otherwise I will send the computer to change Windows 8 to 7.. the service will cost me $140. Not fear  I hope you answer me soon.Thanks for your concern.Luciano SIlvestri

Reviews.Title: great laptop
Reviews.Author: James Giles
Reviews.Content: the colors are very bright. the computer boots up right away/ it is a great buy for the money.better than other brands.

Reviews.Title: Good value
Reviews.Author: Wendy G.
Reviews.Content: Fast start up and processing.  Good battery life.  Only three USB ports but this seems to be common with the newer laptops.  Meets my expectations.

Reviews.Title: Fast machine, nice keyboard, somewhat lacking on indicators, sharp edge on the front.
Reviews.Author: LightGuy48
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my wife to replace a very old Dell Inspiron 6000 laptop.  The computer is extremely fast and has very good performance.  Of course there are the usual complaints about Windows 8 but that's really not a computer issue and FWIW upgrading to 8.1 makes a big difference in usability.My only real complaints are the lack of indicators, I REALLY miss not having a hard drive activity indicator, there are only 3 LED's on the front.  My second complaint is the front edge has a really abrupt sharp edge to it, most laptops have a rounded edge.  My wife says it doesn't bother her but when I use it I find it uncomfortable on my wrist.

Reviews.Title: Excellent for the Price Hate Windows 8
Reviews.Author: Amazonian7
Reviews.Content: The Lenovo laptop is great, especially for the price! As a student that does classes 100% online, it does everything I need and runs quickly making it easy to do my coursework on the go. It loses a star though because it comes with Windows 8 which is a useless pain for a computer that isn't a touch screen or tablet...do yourself a favor and immediately download "Classic Shell" (free) so you can at least have a start button! (Windows 8 doesn't have a start button which is incredibly annoying.) Other than my qualms with Windows 8 the laptop is fantastic and a great buy.

Reviews.Title: This computer is OK
Reviews.Author: Thomas H. Birch
Reviews.Content: It is OK in that it is about as expected.  It is not the fastest computer, but does basic stuff just fine.The finger pad is a bit funky, but I use a mouse most of the time anyway. There are a fewcomputers that are similar in specs for less money, but that is not that critical.

Reviews.Title: Good switch for desktop user
Reviews.Author: Lois Luethy
Reviews.Content: I like the raised keyboard and the number keys on the right.Windows 8 is not as user friendly as 7.

Reviews.Title: Great laptop for the price!
Reviews.Author: Joel Moreno "Jo Black"
Reviews.Content: I recently bought this laptop as a Christmas present for my mother. She really liked and felt very comfortable working with it. This laptop works very fast and smooth. 100% recommended!

Reviews.Title: Touch-screen software (Windows 8) in a keyboard laptop.
Reviews.Author: Otto F. Rohwedder, III "Baby Doc"
Reviews.Content: Windows 8. 'Nuff said. Bought Lenovo due to the quality and durability of their products.  Once you get used to working through Window's 8, it's OK. Next time, it's Apple for me.

Reviews.Title: Hardware is fine, software is a headache.
Reviews.Author: tryingtobehealthy
Reviews.Content: The computer looks pretty good. I like the keyboard and the surface. But Windows 8 is a total failure. Not only it's complicated to use, the wifi connection drops constantly. I've only used it for about 3 hours, but it disconnects wifi almost every ten minutes. So frustrated. Stay away from Windows 8. If you downgrade it to something else, this might be a good laptop.
